address_id.description: A unique identifier associated with the address of the building at which the upgrade(s) will be installed. This id must be obtained using the address-service endpoint.
address_id.title: Address id

ahri_reference_number.title: AHRI reference number
ahri_reference_number.description: The AHRA Reference Number associated with a heat pump or heat pump water heater. See the AHRI Directory of Certified Product Performance at  https://www.ahridirectory.org/Search/SearchHome?ReturnUrl=%2f for more information regarding AHRI Reference Numbers.

applicant_id.description: This identifier is unique to the applicant (the building owner or renter that is to benefit from the rebate). It must be obtained from the API /applicant endpoint.
applicant_id.title: Applicant id

binary_file_content_base_64.description: The API user must convert the binary file content to base64 encoding.
binary_file_content_base_64.title: Binary file content Base64

claimant_payment.description: This is the amount that the state paid to an aggregator, or other claimant, for a HOMES rebate.
claimant_payment.title: Claimant payment

construction_type.title: Construction type
construction_type.description: Set to NEW if the building is less than one year old. Otherwise, set to EXISTING.

contractor_company_name.title: Contractor company name
contractor_company_name.description: The name of the primary contracting company for the project.

contractor_dac_incentive.description: This is the amount the state will pay to a contractor as a disadvantaged-community incentive. This field is required if the address of the building is within a DAC.
contractor_dac_incentive.title: Contractor DAC incentive

contractor_incentive.description: This is the amount the state will pay to a contractor as an incentive. This is separate from any contractor DAC incentive.
contractor_incentive.title: Contractor incentive

contractor_name.title: Contractor name
contractor_name.description: The name of the primary contractor for the project.

count.title: Count
count.description: This should be set to 1 in most cases. An example of a situation where a value greater than 1 is appropriate is when several rolls of insulation are being purchased. Another situation is for `building_project_type` MULTIFAMILY_CENTRAL and `upgrade_type` HEAT_PUMP_WATER_HEATER for which the shared water heating system upgrade consists of multiple identical heat pump water heaters.

deletion_reason.title: Deletion reason
deletion_reason.description: Provide a reason for deleting the reservation. CANCEL_RESERVATION indicates that the intention is to delete the reservation with no immediate intention of replacing it. CORRECT_RESERVATION indicates that the intention is to delete the reservation in order to replace it with another.

delete_redemptions.title: Delete redemptions
delete_redemptions.description: A boolean flag to determine if the redemption(s) for this reservation will be deleted. When this flag is set to true, any associated redemption for the reservation will also be deleted.

doe_approved_bpi_2400_compliant_software.title: DOE approved bpi 2400 compliant software used
doe_approved_bpi_2400_compliant_software.description: This field is required when *rebate_type* is MODELED. Otherwise, this field should be omitted. A list of approved software will be publicly available along with the corresponding string that should be used here. We use a string rather than an enum because the approved list may change often.

electric_building_project_type.title: Building project type
electric_building_project_type.description: This describes both the type of the building and, in the multifamily case, whether the upgrade in this reservation applies to the whole building or to a single unit. If it applies to a single unit, there is a further distinction between an upgrade that is part of a whole building project and a stand-alone upgrade. For the MULTIFAMILY_IN_UNIT_PART_OF_BUILDING_PROJECT and MULTIFAMILY_CENTRAL cases, the income bucket for the building, mf_income_bucket, is used. Otherwise, the income bucket for the dwelling unit, dwelling_unit_income_bucket, is used.

electric_claimant_type.title: Claimant type
electric_claimant_type.description: The type of person or entity that is initiating the rebate process on behalf of the applicant.

electric_dwelling_unit_income_bucket.title: Dwelling unit income bucket
electric_dwelling_unit_income_bucket.description: The household income level of the applicant compared to the area median income (AMI).

electric_equipment_and_material_cost.title: Equipment and material cost
electric_equipment_and_material_cost.description: The total cost of the equipment and materials purchased as part of a redemption.

electric_install_redemptions_equipment_a.title: Equipment and material cost
electric_install_redemptions_equipment_a.description: The total cost of the equipment and materials purchased as part of a redemption.

electric_install_redemptions_installatio.description: The installation costs associated with this redemption. To qualify, the installation must be performed by an approved contractor. Also see `is_contractor_eligible`.
electric_install_redemptions_installatio.title: Installation cost

electric_mf_building_income_bucket.title: Multifamily building income bucket
electric_mf_building_income_bucket.description: Choose the lowest area median income (AMI) range for which at least 50% of the household units fall into the range or lower. For example, consider a five-unit apartment building for which one units falls in the `LESS_THAN_80%_AMI` range, two fall in the `80%_AND_GREATER_BUT_LESS_THAN_150%_AMI`, and the other two have household incomes above these ranges. Then the `80%_AND_GREATER_BUT_LESS_THAN_150%_AMI` range should be chosen because more than half of the units fall into this range or lower.

ambient_co_test_result.description: Testing is only required if the home has one or more combustion appliances post-retrofit.
ambient_co_test_result.title: Ambient CO test result

confirm_all_safety_check_results_disclos.title: Confirm all safety check results disclosed to homeowner

gas_leak_detection_test_result.description: Testing is only required if the home has one or more combustion appliances post-retrofit.
gas_leak_detection_test_result.title: Gas leak detection test result

signs_of_mold_or_moisture.description: Contractor should not proceed with energy efficiency measures until mold and moisture issues are mitigated.
signs_of_mold_or_moisture.title: Signs of mold or moisture

spillage_test_result.description: Testing is only required if the home has one or more combustion appliances post-retrofit.
spillage_test_result.title: Spillage test result

undiluted_co_test_result.description: Testing is only required if the home has one or more combustion appliances post-retrofit.
undiluted_co_test_result.title: Undiluted CO test result

venting_test_result.description: Testing is only required if the home has one or more combustion appliances post-retrofit.
venting_test_result.title: Venting test result

energy_data_evaluation_permission.description: Set to true if the home/building owner has given their permission to share energy data with the State and the DOE for evaluation purposes.
energy_data_evaluation_permission.title: Energy data evaluation permission

estimated_post_retrofit_energy_usage_kwh.title: Estimated post retrofit energy usage kwh equivalent
estimated_post_retrofit_energy_usage_kwh.description: The total estimated (expected) annual  energy usage converted to kWh-equivalent for the home or multifamily building post-retrofit. This field is used for MEASURED reservations only.

external_rebate_id.title: External rebate id
external_rebate_id.description: This is an optional field that a state can use for their own purposes to identify a rebate or rebate reservation.

file_name.description: This file name will be associated with the uploaded file and will be shown wherever a list of the uploaded files for a reservation is returned.
file_name.title: File name

homes_building_project_type.title: Building project type
homes_building_project_type.description: This describes both the type of the building and, in the multifamily case, whether this reservation applies to the whole building or to a single unit. For the MULTIFAMILY_CENTRAL case, the income bucket for the building, mf_income_bucket, is used. Otherwise, the income bucket for the dwelling unit, dwelling_unit_income_bucket, is used.

homes_claimant_type.title: Claimant type
homes_claimant_type.description: The type of person or entity that is initiating the rebate process on behalf of the applicant.

homes_dwelling_unit_income_bucket.title: Dwelling unit income bucket
homes_dwelling_unit_income_bucket.description: The household income level of the applicant compared to the area median income (AMI).

homes_equipment_and_material_cost.title: Equipment and material cost
homes_equipment_and_material_cost.description: The total cost of the equipment and materials purchased as part of a redemption.

homes_mf_building_income_bucket.title: Multifamily building income bucket
homes_mf_building_income_bucket.description: Choose the lowest area median income (AMI) range for which at least 50% of the household units fall into the range or lower. For example, consider a five-unit apartment building for which two units fall in the `LESS_THAN_80%_AMI` range and three fall in the `80%_AMI_AND_GREATER`. Then the `80%_AMI_AND_GREATER` range should be chosen because more than half of the units fall into this range or lower.

homes_upgrades.title: Homes upgrades
homes_upgrades.description: List all the upgrades from the enumeration that apply to the HOMES project.

installation_cost.description: The installation costs associated with this redemption. To qualify, the installation must be performed by an approved contractor. Also see `is_contractor_eligible`.
installation_cost.title: Installation cost

is_contractor_eligible.description: The contractor is eligible if they are on the state's approved list.
is_contractor_eligible.title: Is contractor eligible

is_disadvantaged_community.description: This field should only be used by states that have been approved by the DOE to do so. If provided, this will override the is_disadvantaged_community value from the address-service.
is_disadvantaged_community.title: Is disadvantaged community

is_final_project_redemption.description: Set this to true if the project work has been completed and there will be no more redemptions made on this reservation. This will, among other things, free up any remaining reservation amount for the household's future use.
is_final_project_redemption.title: Is final project redemption

measured_post_retrofit_energy_usage_kwh_.title: Measured post retrofit energy usage kwh equivalent
measured_post_retrofit_energy_usage_kwh_.description: The total actual annual energy usage converted to kWh-equivalent for the home or multifamily building post-retrofit - based on normalized utility bill data. This field is used for MEASURED redemptions only.

measured_pre_retrofit_energy_usage_kwh_e.title: Measured pre-retrofit energy usage kwh equivalent
measured_pre_retrofit_energy_usage_kwh_e.description: The total actual annual energy usage converted to kWh-equivalent for the home or multifamily building prior to the retrofit - based on normalized utility bill data. This field is used for MEASURED reservations only.

mf_conditioned_floor_area.title: Multifamily conditioned floor area
mf_conditioned_floor_area.description: The conditioned floor area for the entire multifamily building including common areas.

mf_num_bedrooms.title: Multifamily num bedrooms
mf_num_bedrooms.description: The number of bedrooms for the entire multifamily building.

model_number.title: Model number
model_number.description: The model number for the product being purchased.

modeled_post_retrofit_energy_usage_kwh_e.title: Modeled post retrofit energy usage kwh equivalent
modeled_post_retrofit_energy_usage_kwh_e.description: The total annual modeled energy usage converted to kWh-equivalent for the home or multifamily building post-retrofit. This field is used for MODELED reservations only.

modeled_pre_retrofit_energy_usage_kwh_eq.title: Modeled pre energy usage kwh equivalent
modeled_pre_retrofit_energy_usage_kwh_eq.description: The total annual modeled energy usage converted to kWh-equivalent for the home or multifamily building as-found (prior to the retrofit). This field is used for MODELED reservations only.

new_expiration_date.title: New expiration date
new_expiration_date.description: The new date at which the reservation should be set to expire.
new_expiration_date.$comment: The date format follows RFC 3339, section 5.6:  https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc3339#section-5.6:~:text=Timestamps%20%20%20%20%20%20%20July%202002-,5.6,-.%20Internet%20Date/Time.

num_occupied_units.title: Num occupied units
num_occupied_units.description: This is the number of occupied units in a multifamily building.

num_units.title: Num units
num_units.description: This is the total number of units in a multifamily building. This field is required when *building_project_type* is any of the enumerated values that has a "MULTIFAMILY" prefix. Otherwise, the field should be omitted.

num_units_meeting_income_bucket.title: Num units meeting income bucket
num_units_meeting_income_bucket.description: This is the number of occupied units in a multifamily building for which the household income falls within the income range represented by *mf_income_bucket* or is lower.

original_component_details.title: original component details
original_component_details.description: This object describes the details of the component being replaced. The required fields depend on the upgrade_type and are fully described at https://github.com/pnnl/IRA-Rebates-API/blob/main/json_schemas/electricEligibleRebatesPayload.schema.json.

percent_cost_limit.description: This integer is either 50 or 100 (for electrification) or 50 or 80 (for homes), depending on the income_bucket. It is the percent of project cost that can be covered by the rebate. The actual rebate amount allowed is *min(reservation_amount, percent_cost_limit x project_cost / 100)*.
percent_cost_limit.title: Percent cost limit
percent_cost_limit.$comment: This is a read-only field, automatically populated by the API in the response.

vendor_percent_cost_limit.description: This integer is either 50 or 100 (for electrification) or 50 or 80 (for homes), depending on the income_bucket. It is the percent of project cost that can be covered by the rebate. The actual rebate amount allowed is *min(reservation_amount, percent_cost_limit x project_cost / 100)*.
vendor_percent_cost_limit.title: Percent cost limit
vendor_percent_cost_limit.$comment: This is a read-only field, automatically populated by the API in the response.

portfolio_id.description: Multiple reservations for MEASURED HOMES projects can be tied together into a portfolio by assigning the same portfolio_id value to each reservation in the portfolio.
portfolio_id.title: Portfolio id

product_description.title: Product description
product_description.description: The description of the product being purchased, as it would appear on an invoice.

product_info.description: Provide identifying information for the qualifying product or products that are covered by this rebate.

project_completion_date.title: Project completion date
project_completion_date.description: This is a calendar date in the form YYYY-MM-DD. Time zone is immaterial.

project_id.description: This is a unique string supplied by the API user that is used to associate one or more reservations to a single project. Note: it is recommended that a uuid be used to avoid duplication, but the API user can use any other system that they find convenient, provided that it is unique for the state.
project_id.title: Project id

purchase_date.title: Purchase date
purchase_date.description: This is a calendar date in the form YYYY-MM-DD. Time zone is immaterial. This represents the date the product was purchased. Either this field or 'purchase_date_time' is required for product redemption.

purchase_date_time.title: Purchase date-time
purchase_date_time.description: This is the date and time a product was purchased. Either this field or the 'purchase_date' field is required for product redemption. Note that the 'purchase_date_time' field will be deprecated in the future.
purchase_date_time.$comment: The date-time format follows RFC 3339, section 5.6:  https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc3339#section-5.6:~:text=Timestamps%20%20%20%20%20%20%20July%202002-,5.6,-.%20Internet%20Date/Time.

rebate_deducted.title: Rebate deducted
rebate_deducted.description: This is the amount that was deducted from the customer's/homeowner's purchase price or invoiced amount for products and/or installation.

rebate_passed_through_to_applicant.title: Rebate passed through to applicant
rebate_passed_through_to_applicant.description: Use this field when the contractor submitted a product redemption for this reservation and received a rebate on behalf of the applicant. Otherwise set this to 0. This amount must be passed on to the applicant and shown on the invoice. Do not include this in the amount for `equipment_and_material_cost`.

rebate_type.title: Rebate type
rebate_type.description: The HOMES rebates have two distinct options for determining savings and rebate amounts, MODELED vs MEASURED.

remaining_reservation_amount.description: This is the maximum rebate amount. The rebate amount is also limited to a percentage of the project cost which is given by the *percent_cost_limit* field. Thus, the rebate amount is the smaller of the *reservation_amount* and the percent of the project cost, given by *percent_cost_limit*.
remaining_reservation_amount.title: Remaining reservation amount
remaining_reservation_amount.$comment: This is a read-only field, automatically populated by the API in the response.

redemption_notes.description: This will be an array of strings explaining how the rebate_amount was calculated.
redemption_notes.$comment: This is a read-only field, automatically populated by the API in the response.

reservation_amount.title: Reservation amount
reservation_amount.description: This is the maximum rebate amount.

reservation_amount_note.description: This is an array of strings explaining how the reservation amount was determined.
reservation_amount_note.$comment: This is a read-only field, automatically populated by the API in the response.

reservation_expiration_date_time.description: If the reservation is not redeemed by this date, the reservation will be automatically canceled.

sf_conditioned_floor_area.title: Single-family conditioned floor area
sf_conditioned_floor_area.description: This is the conditioned floor area for an individual dwelling unit, either a single-family home or a unit in a multifamily building.

sf_num_bedrooms.title: Single-family num bedrooms
sf_num_bedrooms.description: The number of bedrooms in the dwelling unit.

software_used_to_estimate_post_retrofit_.title: Software used to estimate measured savings
software_used_to_estimate_post_retrofit_.description: This field is required when `rebate_type` is `MEASURED`.

state_attests_proof_of_identity_ownershi.title: State attests proof of identity ownership income
state_attests_proof_of_identity_ownershi.description: The state attests that they have obtained the required proof of identify, proof of ownership, and proof of income for this rebate.

state_attests_any_failed_inspection_reme.title: State attests any failed inspection remediated

unit_name_or_number.title: Unit name or number
unit_name_or_number.description: This is the unit designator for a unit in a multifamily building. Do NOT include words or abbreviations such as 'APT' or 'UNIT'. For example, if the unit is referred to as 'APT 7B', then *unit_name_or_number* should be '7B'.

upc.title: UPC
upc.description: The universal product code (UPC) for the product being purchased.

upgrade_component_details.title: Upgrade component details
upgrade_component_details.description: This is a JSON object containing the upgrade information specific to the upgrade being installed. The form of these objects will follow the Data and Tools Guide Appendix https://www.energy.gov/scep/articles/ira-home-energy-rebates-data-and-tools-requirements-guide  and will be fully documented here in the next release version.

upgrade_type.title: Upgrade type
upgrade_type.description: The upgrade covered by this reservation. These upgrade types are the ones specifically listed in the IRA legislation.

upgrade_subtype.title: Upgrade suptype
upgrade_subtype.description: The use of this field is state-specific. A state could base a rebate rule on this field value.

vendor_coupon_id.title: Vendor coupon id
vendor_coupon_id.description: The unique identifier for the vendor coupon.

vendor_id.title: Vendor id
vendor_id.description: This is a unique identifier for a vendor that the state will reimburse in connection with a redemption.
